Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone for my purposes
Reviews.Author: Lyle R. Creamer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent mobile phone for making phone calls and sending a VERY FEW text messages.  The battery has excellent endurance but I do not make or receive many calls.  The keyboard functions perfectly but it is a real nuisance for long messages (even with abbreviations).  If you want to send many text messages I don't think this is the phone for you.  If you want internet functions I doubt this is the phone for you.  But, if you want a reliable phone for voice calls and a limited number of text messages, then you should consider this phone.

Reviews.Title: Poor design
Reviews.Author: eweshere
Reviews.Content: We've had a bunch of basic cell phones over the years and many have been LG flip phones. We have always found them to be a good value. However, we do not like the Accolade phones because of a couple of stupid features which have to do with style and performance.First, with this model, they changed the clam shell shape so that when it is closed, the bottom end (opposite the hinge) has no edges or features to grab to get it open. You have to carefully hold it on both sides, top and bottom to fumble it open. Really inconvenient when you are hurrying.Next, they left the camera button active when the phone is closed, with no way to turn it off. It does require that you hold it down briefly, but that can happen easily in a pocket or purse. Our phones were constantly taking stupid noisy black pictures until I took my pocket knife and pried out the rubber buttons.I would not recommend the phone if either of these features bother you. They seem to perform quite well in all other ways.

Reviews.Title: Okay phone, but problematic for texters
Reviews.Author: Matthew B. Sheffield "sbgtf"
Reviews.Content: This is a great basic phone for those of us who don't want anything fancy! Only two real problems: one is pixelation for the pics. if you set a pic as your background then the pixelation is terrible. Problem two, and this is the clincher, is that when you try to text, the letters have extreme difficulty scrolling. What I mean is that on the 6 Key, you have "mno" for texting. If you're trying to type "o" then half the time (no exaggeration) you will get three "m"s instead of an "o." Trying to use the 1 key for punctuation is the worst offended. Most phones have a mild version of this problem, but this on is by far the worst offender. You will be quickly frustrated if you are a texter and you buy this phone. Other than that the phone is great!

Reviews.Title: Two Stars! Here's the good. Here's the bad.
Reviews.Author: FiveStarTexter
Reviews.Content: I own this cell phone for at least one year so here's the deal;Pros:-you can zoom in on the pictures you've already taken-it's durability, as in, I dropped this phone who knows how many times already and it still function great.-small size and can easily slide in your pockets-easy to flip open with one hand if you run your fingers through the sidesCons:-the buttons! they are slow for fast text'ers and it takes a long time to switch letters.  For example, if you want to get to "f" you will type the d's many times in a row.-it takes black pictures when you carry it in your pocket. (had like 20 in one day no joke)-hard to hear on the other end sometimes.-In one day, making a few calls is enough before you need to recharge the phone and text'ing included.-The middle end of the phone where it open or closes, it clips my fingers and it hurts when I close it with one hand.-no simLast, but not least,I don't recommend this phone for constantly daily use like for business (get a new phone) or people who need to text/call a lot on a daily basis.  The battery won't last.  If your a text'er, what are you doing with a basic phone?  You will be irritated by this phone in less than 24 hours.But, I do recommend this for people who don't mind basic functions and uses it once in a while.  This phone is simple to use and easy and hard to break.

Reviews.Title: beast phone
Reviews.Author: tactical texan
Reviews.Content: This phone is perfect if you're an in case of emergency phone user. i had this phone for four years til it finally gave out on me. then i ordered it again on amazon. I dropped it countless times, including in some water, and without a case it lasted that long.quick pros: it's loud, it's durable, the camera's decent, good battery life, it's little (fits in my watch pocket).quick cons: the screen is little(but that probably helps durability), not much memory space(not for you massive texters), and the camera button can accidently be activated in your pocket(not really a big deal).I dont' surf the web unless on my laptop, i don't like to talk on the phone, and i don't text much.what i look for in a phone is: ease of use, durable, and cheapall in all best simple phone i've ever owned

Reviews.Title: Texting and flip screen hinge problems.
Reviews.Author: Matt Sweeney
Reviews.Content: First off, since I feel obligated to point out the good things about the phone, I feel that it's good for what it's supposed to be: a basic phone. I don't use it for internet or anything, just for phone calls and texting. Texting is where the problems arise.Obviously, there's no keyboard and so you must text using the number pad. I'm not even saying this is a bad thing either, I obviously knew that's how I'd have to text when I bought the phone.However, say you wanted to type an o, to use an example. You have to press 6 three times to get there. Because of this, phones give you a "grace period" where when you press the 6 a second time it will switch the m to an n instead of adding a second m. Same with pressing a third time for the o. You know you're still in this grace period if the letter you're on is highlighted in black. People who text with a number pad should be familiar with this.The actual problem arises here: if you press the clear key (backspace) when you're in a "grace period" for a letter, thereafter, for an amount of time that I've been unable to determine, your "grace period" for any further letters you choose to type becomes incredibly short. So unless you have hyper speed fingers, typing an o means instead you'll get 3 ms.Note that this scenario is not uncommon, especially for those who make mistakes texting. This is either some sort of weird texting feature that I can't figure out how to turn off, or just a programming oversight. Either way it's unbearably annoying.The other problem I have is that the joint where it flips has gotten really messed up for me and opens and closes strangely and loudly. I've read that others have had problems with this as well.

Reviews.Title: Verizon Wireless LG Accolade VX5600 Prepaid Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: ROBERT OBRIEN
Reviews.Content: I initially bought this phone to replace my existing Verizon Wireless LG Accolade VX5600 Cell Phone as it had a broken external screen (it was far less expensive as a complete phone than the screens charged by CPR - Cell Phone Repair.Even though my original ohone was a Prepaid, Verizon initialised it as a Post-paid phone, however, they told me this new one could NOT be initialised as a Post-paid, so I just exchanged the electronics between the two phone and I have a new screen and case for my old phone.The Accolade is such an easy machine to dismantle and re-assemble!

Reviews.Content: Love this little cell phone.  Very basic with several available apps. and texting is simple. If you are looking for a basic capable phone i recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Fix for the camera button problem
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I got the VX5600 because I wanted a simple phone with a flip cover that was relatively small and durable. I've been happy with the phone except for one problem - the camera button.If the camera button on the right side of the phone is pressed for a couple of seconds it causes the phone to take a picture. When owners of this phone put it in their pocket or purse they often hear the phone "taking pictures" because something is pressing against the camera button on the side of the phone. You can end up with lots of black pictures that you have to delete. And you have to listen to the camera make its "I just took a picture sound" again and again.I fixed the problem by creating a dome of epoxy glue over the camera button. As a result, the camera button cannot be pressed - either accidentally or on purpose. I also programmed the "Up directional key" as a shortcut for "Take picture".A description of how I did this with pictures can be found at hammerbob dot wordpress dot com, look for the "Camera button fix for the LG Accolade VX5600 cellphone" article.

Reviews.Title: Another great little phone, but...
Reviews.Author: T. Delaune
Reviews.Content: This is the review I wrote for the Motorola phone that I bought from Amazon.com-  "I really liked this phone.  It's just the size I wanted, just a simple phone.  Verizon would not let me use it because it needed to be specific for Verizon.  So, if you are just going to get  a prepaid card I think it would work great, but double check with your provider before purchasing a phone on line.  But Amazon was great and I was able to return it for a complete refund with no problems at all.  After I returned this I went back to Amazon to find a Verizon compatible phone and bought it.  Now, for the kicker, Verizon still wouldn't let me use that phone, I had to return the second one as well.  Amazon has much better customer service than Verizon does."This was the Verizon phone that I mention in the other review.  Once again, Verizon would not let me transfer an existing number to this little phone.  Which is the phone I wanted - I had to get a more costly phone from the store ($50 dollars more) and I still don't like it as much as I like this LG Accolade.

Reviews.Content: I was interested in a basic flip phone for occasional use. This one fills the bill nicely. Flip phones seem to be going the way of the buggy whip, so I was pleased to see something like this available. I particularly like the battery life. On the negative side I don't like the fact that the side buttons are still active when the phone is closed. On a number of occasions I have inadvertently taken pictures of the inside of my pocket.

Reviews.Title: people have no idea what they are talking about
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Temple
Reviews.Content: This is to correct the many reviews out there that are complaining about the texting on this phone. You can change the text input to T9Word, Abc, ABC, 123, or T9 Palabra. T9 word and T9 Palabra are the auto spelling functions that help complete words for you faster in English and Spanish (respectively). This phone is amazing for the price, and I use it and carry my iPhone with me because I can get wifi practically wherever I go, so this phone saves me approx. $30 a mo....

Reviews.Title: BIGGEST PROBLEM IS DECIFERING THE INSTRUCTIONS
Reviews.Author: Roy Berger "Everyman"
Reviews.Content: I will only use this for 911 emergency calls and the time. So, I have no idea how hard it may be to decifer the rest of the manual. The problem was that the instructions call the buttons by different names than the illustration and the button name itself. Instead of using Power/Off for the on/off button, it would have been clearer if the on/off logo of a circle with a vertical line partway through it had been used. There are other buttons I had a problem with, but by trial and error I've gotten it to do what I want it to do.

Reviews.Title: new phone

Reviews.Content: This was a replacement phone to have on hand when the old one ceases to work.  So far that hasn't happened.

Reviews.Title: Great coverage battery is another thing
Reviews.Author: C. Coggins
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed my phone.  I don't get dropped and it does what it should.  However if you want to use the web the print is way too small and of course you would want a real keyboard.  The main problem I find is the battery does not hold a good charge.  I have had my phone for 7 months and need a new battery already. I went to the store to purchase the battery and asked for an extended battery and new cover that would work with the battery.  They ordered it and it was at my door the next day.  The problem was the cover/door was a standard and of course would not work with the battery.  I took it back to the store and they looked into it and found they sell the battery but not the cover/door.  What good is the battery if you don't have a back on the phone????  Very disappointed.  When the battery dies I will get another type of phone.  It is too bad I really like the phone but you need a battery that is reliable.

Reviews.Title: Fragile Front LCD; NOT covered by Verizon!
Reviews.Author: S. Rowles
Reviews.Content: BE AWARE OF THE FOLLOWING PERSONAL EXPERIENCE:I had this phone for no more than 3 weeks and the top LCD screen broke. Verizon will NOT cover the from screen even if you have a contract with them, and even if you just got the phone less than 3 weeks ago! They basically insinuated that I "abused' the phone, which is total crap. I take meticulous care of this phone and have never dropped it. It always stays in my pocket. The only way to have had this covered was to get a $40 'protection' plan for a $60 phone. What's wrong with that picture?Aside from that, it's functional. If you are a texter, forget it.

Reviews.Title: six months as prepaid before this phone can be in your Verizon phone plan
Reviews.Author: benedicta
Reviews.Content: You may want to consider, if you want to "activate" this phone into your Verizon plan, that Verizon will not let you do that unless you use the phone 6 months as a prepaid, pay-as-you go.  That's what Verizon told me September, 2012.Who has six months?Well, good luck to all of us, because the phone is very cheaply made, has slow camera action, and even a non-technical person such as myself can tell there is just no fun, no art, and no joy in using this one.  So, will the phone work six months?LG makes nice phones and I had no idea the pre-paid lg Accolade is this useless.  In spy novels, sometimes, a villain will  phone with a pre-paid phone, so as not to be traced...after the phone call, the villain tosses the pre-paid into a dumpster.  Ok, I knew that and did not connect the dots, so shame on me for expecting quality.Perhaps a used LG on Amazon would make a nice phone for your use, and verizon won't make you wait six months.  As you know a used Sprint or ATT phone won't work with Verizon towers, they tell me, so read the fine print.  And good luck to all of us.
